business.headline: India offers to lower US farm tariffs, looks to strengthen trade ties: ReportIndia-US trade talk: The government has proposed reducing import duties on several US agricultural products, including almonds, walnuts, cranberries, pistachios, and lentils.

Why is stock market falling today? 3 things investors need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 339.66 points to 77,266.77 at 1:13 pm and the NSE Nifty50 traded 100.45 points lower to trade at 23,491.50. Here are three important points retail investors need to know.

India's billionaires have wealth bigger than Saudi Arabia's GDP. Check detailsIndia's billionaires now have a combined wealth that exceeds the entire economy of Saudi Arabia. India ranks third globally in the number of billionaires, behind the United States and China.

Health insurance rejected? Here are 5 things you need to knowUnderstanding why health insurance claims are rejected is important as it will help you avoid unnecessary stress or financial burden during medical emergencies.

How this scheme can help you save Rs 20 lakh in 15 years for daughterIf you are planning for your daughter's higher education expenses, the Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) can be a great savings option.

Razorpay's Shashank Kumar, Harshil Mathur become India's youngest billionairesHarshil Mathur and Shashank Kumar met at IIT Roorkee, where they shared an interest in technology and problem-solving. Their journey into fintech began in 2014 when they launched Razorpay to simplify digital payments in India.
Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade over Trump tariff threats; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 282.59 points to 77,323.84, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 84.70 points to 23,507.25 as of 9:42 am.
Planning a bank transfer on March 31? Here's why it may not workWhile banks will remain open, transactions like fund transfers, cash deposits, and withdrawals may not go through.

Stocks to watch today: Infosys, Tata Motors, BEL, Adani Power, HCLTech and moreMarkets are set for a strong start on March 6 as key stocks like Infosys, Tata Motors, and Adani Power grab attention. Trade talks, global deals, and company moves could shape today's trading session. Here's what investors need to know.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will positive run continue on stock market?Stock market opening today: The Sensex and Nifty gained in the previous session amid reports of positive talks between Indian and US officials about a trade deal. Analysts have noted that the focus during today's trading session will be on upcoming tariff developments and the India-US trade deal outcome.
US suspends WTO financial contributions: ReportThe Trump administration has reportedly suspended financial contributions to The World Trade Organisation amid efforts to cut back government spending.
Wall Street drifts as auto tariffs hurt GM, help Tesla and othersDonald Trump's auto tariffs impacted Wall Street on Thursday morning, with autogiant General Motors falling by 6.8%.

entertainment.headline: Ananya Panday's reaction to 'Mr World Wide' Walker Blanco's post has fans talkingActor Ananya Panday has once again got the internet talking with her comment on rumoured boyfriend Walker Blanco's post. The two have reportedly been dating after Anant Ambani's Jamnagar bash.

Actor Shruti Haasan's Hyderabad live concert postponed. Here's whyActor Shruti Haasan was supposed to perform a live concert in Hyderabad on March 28. However, the event was postponed hours before the scheduled time.

Decoding Akshaye Khanna's secret to staying relevant in BollywoodDespite his absence from the public eye, actor Akshaye Khanna has managed to stay relevant through his iconic film choices and powerful performances. On his 50th birthday today, we take a look at his illustrious filmography and how he has redefined versatility and excellence in Indian cinema.

Salman Khan says 'Hindu-Muslim wasn't the issue' in parents' marriageSalman Khan revealed that the biggest hurdle in his parents' marriage wasn't religion but Salim Khan's career in Bollywood. Salim and Salma Khan got married in 1964.

Tamil actor Shruthi Narayanan reacts after alleged casting couch video leakTamil actor Shruthi Narayanan addressed the controversy after her alleged casting couch video surfaced online, urging people not to circulate it further. She described the situation as challenging for her family and herself, appealing for sensitivity and respect

Kartik Aaryan can't take his eyes off 'zindagi' Sreeleela in new picKartik Aaryan and Sreeleela shared a new romantic photo on social media. The image featured the two sitting in what seemed like a tea garden. The photo spoke volumes of their chemistry.

Actor Vikram takes auto to avoid crowd after meeting Sivakarthikeyan at screeningActor Vikram, fondly called Chiyaan by fans, attended the screening of his film, Veera Dheera Sooran's Part 2, in Chennai. After the screening, the actor left for his home in an auto to avoid the crowd at the theatre.

Shivaji Satam on CID's success: We seem like real heroes, we don't fly or jumpShivaji Satam talked about CID's animated version, the show's enduring legacy, and its return to TV. He reflected on its cult status, meme culture, and why it never glorified violence or crime.

Honey Bunny actor reacts after being mistaken for Tamil star Shruthi Narayanan'Citadel: Honey Bunny' actor Shruti Narayann has faced personal and professional challenges due to being mistaken for Tamil actor Shruthi Narayanan. The mix-up has led to harassment and work-related setbacks for Narayann.

Neha Kakkar's husband defends her after Melbourne concert backlashSinger Neha Kakkar defended herself after facing backlash in Melbourne, revealing organisers fled with funds. Husband Rohanpreet Singh supported her, urging people not to judge without knowing both sides.

Kartik Aaryan's Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri eyes Valentine's Day 2026Kartik Aaryan's upcoming film Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri is scheduled to hit theatres on Valentine's Day 2026. As per reports, Ananya Panday is set to star alongside Aaryan.

Sikandar advance booking: Salman's film beats Kisi Ka Bhai pre-sales before releaseSalman Khan's 'Sikandar' is heading for a good opening day at the box office. The film has grossed decent numbers in its advance booking so far with two more days to go for release.

Pics: Inside Ram Charan's 40th birthday bash hosted by wife Upasana KamineniRam Charan turned 40 years old on March 27. His wife, Upasana Kamineni, hosted a grand birthday bash for him, which was attended by actor Lakshmi Manchu, Mahesh Babu's wife, Namrata Shirodkar, and others.

Raid 2 teaser: It is Ajay Devgn vs Riteish Deshmukh in this gripping dramaAjay Devgn returns as IRS officer Amay Patnaik in Raid 2. The teaser hints at a high-stakes showdown with Riteish Deshmukh's character. Directed by Raj Kumar Gupta, the film releases on May 1.

Hrithik Roshan to turn director with Krrish 4, father Rakesh Roshan announces'Krrish 4', which is India's biggest superhero franchise, is now being directed by the 'superhero' himself, Hrithik Roshan. The film will be produced by YRF.

Ground Zero teaser: Emraan Hashmi leads a daring mission in intense war dramaEmraan Hashmi stars as BSF officer Narendra Nath Dubey in Ground Zero, inspired by real events. The teaser promises an intense war thriller, backed by Excel Entertainment, and also stars Sai Tamhankar.

Kartik Aaryan, Sreeleela's viral pics, videos from Anurag Basu's film set in SiliguriKartik Aaryan and Sreeleela are currently shooting in Siiguri, West Bengal, for their upcoming untitled film by Anurag Basu. Several pictures of the two from the sets have emerged online.

Mohanlal's Empuraan leaked online hours after release, police to take actionMohanlal and Prithviraj Sukumaran's L2: Empuraan was leaked online hours after its grand release. According to reports, the Kerala police launched a probe to look into the source of the leak.

Jackson Wang turns 31: Celebrating music, boundaries, and self-love with GBADJackson Wang drops his second song from Magic Man 2 titled GBAD. The K-pop star explores the theme of setting boundaries in this song. He also turns 31.

general news.headline: Huge earthquake hits Myanmar, 2 dead in Bangkok building collapse Live UpdatesMyanmar Earthquake News: Such was the impact of the earthquake that a high-rise collapsed in Bangkok, around 900 km away, killing two labourers and trapping over 40 others.
India reports eight outbreaks of bird flu in Andhra Pradesh: ReportIndia has reported eight outbreaks of highly pathogenic H5N1 bird flu in farms and backyard poultry in Andhra Pradesh.

Supreme Court's big remark on freedom of speech: Satire enriches lifeThe Supreme Court's remarks came as it quashed an FIR filed against Congress MP Imran Pratapgarhi over a poem uploaded by him on social media. It holds importance in the backdrop of the Kunal Kamra row.

Tell everyone I killed her: Bengaluru techie phoned father after murdering wifeIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, Rajendra, the father of the man accused of murdering his wife in Bengaluru and stuffing her body in a suitcase, revealed what his son told him about the murder.

Videos: Building collapses in Bangkok, bridge falls in Myanmar after major quakesTwo powerful earthquakes, measuring 7.7 and 6.4 in magnitude, hit Myanmar on Friday. The tremors were so strong that they were felt in Thailand's capital, Bangkok.

India ready to assist: PM Modi after massive earthquake jolts Myanmar, ThailandExpressing concern over two back-to-back earthquakes of magnitudes 7.7 and 6.4 that struck Myanmar earlier today, PM Modi reached out to the Southeast Asian nation and Thailand, assuring assistance and offering prayers 'for the safety and well-being of everyone.'

Cash row: Supreme Court dismisses FIR plea against judge, calls it prematureA huge stash of cash was found from the residence of Justice Yashwant Varma after a fire incident. The Supreme Court said a panel of judges set up by the Chief Justice was probing the matter.

Terrorist Hamas out, Gazans chant amid two days of rare protest in GazaConfronted by the never-ending death and destruction, thousands of Gazans took to the streets against Hamas for two consecutive days. They defied Hamas, a Palestinian terror group, which claims to represent the Gazans. The angry people of Gaza want Hamas to go even as the death toll from the war with Israel crosses 50,000.

Video: Massive fire at Greater Noida girls' hostel, students jump from balconyAn AC compressor blast sparked a huge fire at a girls' hostel in Greater Noida where two girls jumped from the second floor to save themselves.

Amid AI job threats, Bill Gates lists 3 professions that are safeMicrosoft founder Bill Gates has recently stated that while the AI job threat is real, there are a few careers that will not be affected. In an interview, he highlighted that energy professionals, biologists, and coders will be irreplaceable.

Video: Infinity pool turns waterfall as tremors jolt Bangkok after Myanmar quakeA video of the earthquake captured the impact, showing water spilling from rooftop pools of a high-rise building in Bangkok due to the intense shaking.
Are banks secretly charging you? List of hidden fees every Indian must knowThink your bank services are free? Think again, hidden fees could be draining your money.

Hrithik Roshan to turn director with Krrish 4, father Rakesh Roshan announces'Krrish 4', which is India's biggest superhero franchise, is now being directed by the 'superhero' himself, Hrithik Roshan. The film will be produced by YRF.

3 cops killed in gunfight in J&K's Kathua, 3 terrorists shot deadThree policemen were killed, and three terrorists were gunned down in a gunbattle that broke out between them in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua on Thursday.

Rhea Chakraborty deserves an apologyRhea Chakraborty found herself in the midst of a raging controversy when Sushant Singh Rajput, a talented Hindi film star, was found dead in his Mumbai home in June 2020.

MP Board Class 5th, 8th Result 2025 Declared: Direct link to check scorecardsThe Rajya Shiksha Kendra (RSK), Madhya Pradesh, has officially declared the MP Board Class 5 and Class 8 final exam results today, March 28, 2025, at 1 pm. Students who appeared for the 2024-25 academic session can now check their results on the official website – rskmp.in.

Decoding Akshaye Khanna's secret to staying relevant in BollywoodDespite his absence from the public eye, actor Akshaye Khanna has managed to stay relevant through his iconic film choices and powerful performances. On his 50th birthday today, we take a look at his illustrious filmography and how he has redefined versatility and excellence in Indian cinema.

10 test HIV positive in Kerala, officials link spread to shared drug syringesTen people have tested positive for HIV in two months in Kerala's Malappuram district. Health officials attributed the spread to shared syringes among drug users and warned of a potential surge.

Want to join politics? Be ready to spend Rs 3-4 lakh every monthA new study reveals extensive pre-election expenses, sale of nominations and growing vote-buying, creating an 'oligarchisation of democracy' where money determines power

Myanmar earthquake: Why this region is vulnerable to deadly seismic eventsThe seismic event highlights Myanmar's vulnerability to earthquakes, largely due to its location along the Sagaing Fault, a major tectonic boundary between the Indian Plate and the Burma microplate.

Neha Kakkar's husband defends her after Melbourne concert backlashSinger Neha Kakkar defended herself after facing backlash in Melbourne, revealing organisers fled with funds. Husband Rohanpreet Singh supported her, urging people not to judge without knowing both sides.

CSK vs RCB preview: A grudge match in a rivalry of hype and passionIPL 2025 CSK vs RCB match preview: Chennai and Bengaluru renew their fiery rivalry in IPL 2025's first Southern Derby at Chepauk. While history favours Chennai, Bengaluru's emotionally charged win last year adds extra spice to this much-hyped showdown.

At heart of Bengaluru techie killing wife, her unemployment, financial stressRakesh, who was arrested in Pune on Friday, stuffed his wife's body into a suitcase, and abandoned it at their house in Bengaluru before fleeing.
Want to be a Google engineering manager? Techie shares 10 tips to get hiredIn a now-viral post on LinkedIn, a San Francisco-based techie shared 10 tips for those eyeing a leadership role at Google.

sports.headline: Shardul Thakur going unsold in IPL 2025 auction still baffling: Robin UthappaRobin Uthappa said that he finds it baffling that Shardul Thakur went unsold during the IPL 2025 auction. Shardul was the star of the show with the ball as LSG defeated SRH on Thursday, March 27 in Hyderabad.

BCCI invites applications for spin bowling coach at Centre Of ExcellenceThe BCCI on Frdiay, March 23 announced that they are inviting applications for the role of spin bowling coach at the Centre Of Excellence in Bengaluru.

MS Dhoni looks to heal past wounds after 2024 heartbreakIPL 2025: MS Dhoni couldn't help Chennai Super Kings qualify for the playoffs after the five-time champions lost to Royal Challengers Bengaluru at the Chinnaswamy last year. Dhoni will be looking to make amends when the two teams meet on Friday at the Chepauk.

Handshake derby: CSK, RCB meet again after infamous Chinnaswamy encounterChennai Super Kings and Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) face off for the first time this season in the Indian Premier League. This marks the first meeting between the two teams since the infamous fixture at Chinnaswamy, where RCB fans heckled CSK supporters after qualifying for the playoffs last season.

Novak Djokovic sets all-time record, Eala's dream run ends in heartbreakMiami Open 2025: Novak Djokovic became the oldest to reach the semi-finals of an ATP Masters 1000 event after beating Sebastian Korda in straight sets. 19-year-old Alexandra Eala lost to Jessica Pegula in a three-set thriller.

Chennai's MS Dhoni fixation doesn't serve game well: Ambati Rayudu before CSK vs RCBAmbati Rayudu feels that the fixation the Chennai crowd have towards MS Dhoni isn't serving the game and the other CSK players well. Fans have been often chanting for Dhoni and hoping that a wicket falls so that the CSK star comes out to bat.

Are RCB over-reliant on Virat Kohli? CSK coach Stephen Fleming reactsChennai Super Kings coach Stephen Fleming has responded to the query about whether Royal Challengers Bengaluru are over-reliant on Virat Kohli ahead of the South Indian derby on Friday, March 28. Kohli has got a good record playing against CSK in the IPL.

SRH doesn't take any team lightly in IPL: Heinrich Klaasen comments after LSG lossHeinrich Klaasen has claimed that Sunrisers Hyderabad don't take any team lightly in the IPL after their loss to LSG on Thursday, March 27. Lucknow defeated Hyderabad by 5 wickets as the SRH's destructive batting was tied down in Hyderabad.

Proud of the way Prince Yadav bowled: Marsh in awe of LSG pacerIPL 2025, SRH vs LSG: Mitchell Marsh was impressed with fast bowler Prince Yadav after he got the wicket of Travis Head with a beauty on Thursday at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium.

Kohli doesn't have a good record against CSK at the MA Chidamabaram Stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
